article.headline: Creighton 63, Louisiana-Lafayette 58
article.story: OMAHA, Neb. -- Kenny Lawson Jr. had 15 points and 11 rebounds to lead Creighton past Louisiana-Lafayette 63-58 Wednesday night. Antoine Young added 13 points, Doug McDermott had 12 and Greg McDermott became the first coach to start his Creighton career 3-0 since 1921. Randell Daigle hit seven 3s and led the Ragin' Cajuns (1-2) with 25 points. Josh Brown added 13. The Bluejays ended the first half on a 9-2 run for a 34-28 advantage and then scored the first five points of the second half. A 3-pointer by Darryl Ashford put Creighton up 52-39 with 9:22 to play. Louisiana-Lafayette quickly cut the lead to single digits but couldn't get closer than four. The victory was the Creighton's 100th -- in 118 games -- at Qwest Center Omaha, which opened in 2003.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
